alumniOf.name:
NY. He served in the U.S. Air Force from 2000-2007. He is a veteran of Operation Enduring Freedom and received the Joint Service Achievement Medal for his work as a Spanish linguist for the Defense Intelligence Agency in 2005. William graduated from Campbell University in 2007 with a degree in computer science. He earned his J.D. in 2011 from the North Carolina Central University School of Law. His practice areas include immigration law and criminal defense cases. He is licensed and in good standing with the State Bar of North Carolina and a member of the American Immigration Lawyer Association (AILA.) He is a proud member of the Charlotte community and provides compassionate counsel for all his clients.

content.heroSection:
Raleigh, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers

Workplace injuries take place all over the United States, and they can be the result of all types of accidents and incidents, but they have one thing in common – they happened on the job! If you were injured at work, and if your injury has prevented you from working or has caused or exacerbated your depression or anxiety, you could be entitled to compensation. 

The Raleigh workers’ comp lawyers at Vasquez Law Firm are experienced with helping clients who have been injured on the job seek the amount of damages that they deserve. Reach out to schedule a free consultation online and learn how we can help you settle your worker’s comp claim. 

Types Of Workplace Injuries

Workplace injuries are generally thought of as occurring at construction sites or in other types of physically demanding jobs, but the truth is that they can happen to anyone in any type of workplace. Our Raleigh workers’ comp lawyers have represented clients with injuries that were sustained in all kinds of spaces, including offices. Some of the types of workers’ comp injuries we represent at Vasquez Law Firm include, but are not limited to:

  • Overexertion and heavy lifting: Injuries related to overexertion and heavy lifting account for most of the workplace injuries suffered by Americans, according to OSHA. Most of these injuries occur as a result of unsafe practices such as attempting to lift too much weight at once, lifting from an awkward position, and repetitive motions of lifting or carrying. 
  • Repetitive motion: When workers are required to perform repetitive tasks no matter how small, the repetition can cause strain that over time leads to injuries. Some common conditions that can result from repetitive motion tasks are carpal tunnel syndrome, knee injuries, shoulder and rotator cuff injuries, tendonitis, herniated discs, stress fractures, and more. 
  • Equipment: When heavy equipment is involved, operators are at risk of injury or even fatality. Industrial laborers are exposed to risks from equipment that can malfunction, toxic chemicals, electric shock, and machinery that has been worn down over time. 
  • Construction site: Construction sites are by their nature dangerous, and there are countless ways that injuries can occur on these sites. Everything from electrical shock and explosion to faulty equipment and vehicle accidents could be a reason someone is injured on a construction site. 
  • Mental health: Not many people think of depression and anxiety as a workers’ comp issue, but when you are injured on the job and you suffer a blow to your mental health because of anxiety surrounding the job that injured you or depression due to your injuries, workers’ compensation can also be used to pay for your mental healthcare.

These are a few of the more common workplace injury possibilities, but they are not the only injuries that occur in the workplace. If you have sustained an injury on the job, we want to hear from you. 

Why Do I Need A Workers’ Comp Lawyer If I’ve Been Injured? 

Even though you may be entitled to compensation, working with insurance can be tricky. Insurance companies are worried about their bottom line at the end of the day, and employers can be reluctant to cooperate. Even if you are offered some compensation for your injury, it might not be enough to cover your medical bills and the wages that you lost when you were not able to go to work. At Vasquez Law Group, we believe in fighting for what you are owed until it is paid to you in full. 

Trust Our Raleigh Workers’ Comp Lawyers To Seek Justice For You

With over 35 years of combined experience, Vasquez Law Group knows what it means to fight for workers’ comp. We want justice for the injuries you have suffered. We are bilingual representatives – we want to hear your story and we want you to know that you will be understood. Reach out to us to schedule a free consultation and learn how we can win compensation on your behalf. 

Practice Areas

  • Raleigh, NC Workers’ Comp Lawyers

mainEntity.name: How long does the immigration process take?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration timelines vary greatly depending on your case type. Green card applications can take 8-33 months, while citizenship typically takes 8-12 months. Contact Vasquez Law Firm for a personalized timeline assessment.

mainEntity.name: Do I need an immigration lawyer?

acceptedAnswer.text: While not required, an immigration lawyer significantly improves your chances of success. Immigration law is complex and constantly changing. Our attorneys at Vasquez Law Firm ensure your application is complete and accurate.

mainEntity.name: How much does an immigration lawyer cost in Charlotte?

acceptedAnswer.text: Immigration attorney fees vary by case complexity. Vasquez Law Firm offers competitive rates and payment plans. Call 1-844-YO-PELEO for a free consultation and fee quote.

## Serving Charlotte and Surrounding Areas
Vasquez Law Firm proudly serves clients throughout Charlotte, Mecklenburg County, and the greater North Carolina area. With offices conveniently located in Charlotte, we're here to help with all your legal needs.


## Why Choose Vasquez Law Firm?
- **Experienced Attorneys**: Over 20 years of combined legal experience
- **Bilingual Services**: We speak English and Spanish
- **Free Consultation**: Call 1-844-YO-PELEO today
- **Proven Results**: Hundreds of satisfied clients
- **24/7 Availability**: We're here when you need us
